result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Gary L. Riedel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Count 1 in Deferred Prosecution Agreement (verbal).
Defendant to report to Probation today February 12, 2016 by 2:30 p.m.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

-Cooperate with any other Evaluation, Assessment and/or Program as requested and complete any recommended treatment.

Probation review hearing at 05-16-2016 04:30 pm

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Rohan, ADA:  Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  Joseph H. Loso   DF:  Gary L. Riedel appeared. Case called at 1:03 pm. Was time set for status conference. ADA Correll states an agreement has been reached. Recess 1:10 pm. On the record at 1:35 pm. Court met with Counsel in chambers. ADA Correll files Amended Complaint - adds Ct. 2 - Disorderly Conduct. Recites Agreement. Atty. Loso files Plea Questionnaire. Court reads Amended Complaint and maximum penalties. DEF understands. DEF enters G plea to Ct. 2. Court advises DEF of rights. Court finds G plea in Ct. 2 entered freely and voluntarily. Court finds DEF guilty of Ct. 2. Court Orders Count 1 remains open. ADA Correll makes recommendation. Atty. Loso responds. Court reserves issue of restitution for 30 days. DEF makes statement. Court Orders:
Ct. 1 - Deferred Prosecution
-comply with terms of probation
-will be dismissed in 1 year if probation is successfully completed

Ct. 2 - SENT W/H
- 1 year probation     
- 60 Days Jail STAYED
-DEF is to have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Victim D.F.R. DOB 3/21/97.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  
- Sex offender assessment within 60 days and follow through with recommended treatment
- Psychological/ Psychiatric Evaluation if requested by agent within 30 days and follow all recommendations
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested and complete any recommended treatment
-  Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.
- Costs
- Sign up for probation by 2:30 today
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees  

Probation review hearing scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 04:30 pm.
Status conference at 02-12-2016 01:00 pm

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, D.F.R dob 3/21/1997. or any females under the age of 18 years of age.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.
 
Court authorizes visitation with O.P.R. dob 11/3/2015 and A.R.R. dob 6/28/2004 but it must be supervised at all times by Ms. Reidel

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
